alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 549 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Los Lunas, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Valencia and Bernalillo Counties. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 130 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands
